articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Washington said it was trying to keep Israel and the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas engaged "if only virtually" in Gaza truce efforts as a U.N. agency warned that humanitarian aid stocks in the devastated enclave have hit "the bottom of the barrel."
articles.title: US working to keep Israel, Hamas engaged in Gaza truce efforts

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Simon Lewis
articles.description: The Biden administration on Friday said Israel's use of U.S.-supplied weapons may have violated international humanitarian law during its military operation in Gaza, a major step up in criticism of its key ally.
articles.title: US says Israel's use of weapons may have violated international law

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly on Friday overwhelmingly backed a Palestinian bid to become a full U.N. member by recognizing it as qualified to join and recommending the U.N. Security Council "reconsider the matter favorably."
articles.title: UN General Assembly backs Palestinian bid for membership

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Africa has asked the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to order Israel to withdraw from Rafah as part of additional emergency measures over the war in Gaza, the U.N.'s top court said on Friday.
articles.title: South Africa asks World Court to order Israel's withdrawal from Rafah

articles.author: Sergiy Karazy, Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Russian forces launched an armoured ground attack on Friday near Ukraine's second city of Kharkiv in the northeast of the country and made small inroads, opening a new front in a war that has long been waged in the east and south.
articles.title: Russian forces attack Ukraine's Kharkiv region, opening new front

articles.author: Dave Graham
articles.description: An upcoming Ukraine peace summit, ostensibly the most ambitious bid in years by neutral Switzerland to mediate a major conflict, is instead showing how Swiss economic and security interests increasingly align with Western Europe over Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine peace summit pushes neutral Swiss toward Western embrace

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jody Godoy
articles.description: Donald Trump returned to court on Friday after porn star Stormy Daniels' lurid testimony about her alleged sexual encounter with him, as prosecutors prepared to call their final witnesses in the first-ever criminal trial of a sitting or former U.S. president.
articles.title: Trump arrives at hush money trial as prosecutors prepare for final witnesses

articles.author: Niket Nishant, Svea Herbst-Bayliss
articles.description: Billionaire investor James Simons, the mathematician and Cold War code-breaker who founded one of the world's most prominent and profitable hedge funds, Renaissance Technologies, has died at 86, his foundation said on Friday.
articles.title: Billionaire quant investing pioneer and philanthropist James Simons dies at 86

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ten cities in Mexico registered record-high temperatures in 10 cities, including the capital, authorities said on Friday, amid a searing heat wave that has prompted blackouts nationwide and pushed the power grid to the brink.
articles.title: Mexico heat wave melts temperature records in ten cities, including Mexico City

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Israeli forces bombarded areas of Rafah on Thursday, Palestinian residents said, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dismissed U.S. President Joe Biden's threat to withhold weapons from Israel if it assaults the southern Gaza city.
articles.title: Israel strikes eastern Rafah as ceasefire talks end with no deal
